person.name: Bryan Daniel Kaufman
person.subtitle: Beloved math, physics and science teacher, props master and friend.
person.header_note: Memories from the Eastwood Arts Alumni Facebook group.

cover.image: images/backgrounds/vintage theater stage - background space and moon.png

comments.author: Sandy Bethell
comments.message: Wonderful human! Musicals with Bryan were mystical. Have a problem? Need a fire onstage? Ask Bryan and he would magically manifest one-safely! Bubbling water-no problem. A glass that would break without shattering/he did it! Loved creating with Bryan. One of the beautiful and unique opportunities at Eastwood were the fun times we had collaborating and solving problems for productions. Mr. Kaufman was a genius, always with a twinkle in his eye and a knowing smirk that his wizardry would unfold seamlessly! Respect and admiration galore!

comments.author: Hannah Meghan Celinski
comments.message: Mr. Kaufman was an incredible teacher, and a fantastic person. He was a neighbor to my mother later on, and he was very good to her. And, of course, he was always good to me. He will be greatly missed by all who knew him.

comments.author: Shanon Margaret
comments.message: Oh goodness! My oldest is in high school and a few days ago I was telling her about this wonderful physics teacher I once had...I hope his family finds solace in those who so fondly remember him.

comments.author: Arlene Thomas
comments.message: He was awesome and so kind!

comments.author: Adam Schoales
comments.message: I never had him as a teacher (he was before my time) but got to interview him for the 50th Anniversary and he was so warm and kind and seemed like an absolutely incredible guy.

comments.author: Hannah Hastings-Fuhr
comments.message: He was so involved. I didn't take any of his classes. But he participated in so many other things, that I feel I actually knew him. What a sad loss.

comments.author: Bridget Anne Hatchwell
comments.message: The only teacher that caught me skipping his class once and never got me in trouble! He was a very good teacher. I actually vividly remember his business math class, teaching us about the new technology arising, the electronic wallet (we now call a debit card)!

comments.author: Josh Fairbairn
comments.message: The absolute best physics teacher and propsmaster Eastwood ever had. I adored his classes and his props work.

comments.author: Glenn West
comments.message: Some 20 years ago I randomly bumped into him on the sidewalk in KW. Talked for like 20 minutes. He was a great teacher, and always took time to discuss my random questions during and after class (even years after class.)

comments.author: Kirsty Huns-Sho
comments.message: Lovely guy. He wasn't working for very long after I started, but he was definitely lovely.

comments.author: Katia Grubisic
comments.message: Oh, no. My condolences to his family.

comments.author: Steve Spence
comments.message: Wow. He was my grade 10 math teacher, and then was a faculty friend of mine.

comments.author: Robyn Hesch Wilk
comments.message: Very sad to hear. Mr. Kaufman was the best!! Condolences to his family. By far my favourite teacher ever.
